Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown ribbed pottery vessel, fabric is red-black in section, exterior covered with a self-slip and faint traces of five and two lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.182, pl.2)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36422) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36422)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 280 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13468 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
